client-server model it requires that every client has to maintain
a distinct credential for every server that it accesses so if you look at who
is for example if you wanted a query who isn't calm for a dot-com domain name and
if you wanted to query the Whois for a dot org domain name you need to have two separate set of credentials to get
appropriate access in a federated model what it means is that the clients only
need one credential and with that single credential they can access multiple our

management what it also means is that from the server side from the serving side the client token that comes through
